title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The graph of <math alttext="y equals, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals, f double prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€³</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of f in the x y coordinate plane. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a smooth curve. The curve begins below the x axis, where x equals negative 3, and moves gradually upward and to the right, becoming steeper as it crosses the origin, before levelling off and ending above the x axis where x equals 3.

The figure presents the graph of f in the x y coordinate plane. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a smooth curve. The curve begins just above the x axis, where x equals negative 3, and moves gradually upward and to the right until it levels off at the point with approximate coordinates negative 0.5 comma 0.8. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crosses the origin, and levels off at the point with approximate coordinates 0.5 comma negative 0.8. The curve then moves gradually upward and to the right, before levelling off and ending just below the x axis where x equals 3.

The figure presents the graph of f in the x y coordinate plane. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a smooth curve. The curve begins just above the x axis, where x equals negative 3, and moves gradually upward and to the right until it levels off at the point with approximate coordinates negative 1 comma 0.5. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately negative 0.5, and levels off on the y axis at negative 2. The curve then moves steeply upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 0.5, and levels off at the point with approximate coordinates 1 comma 0.5. The curve then moves gradually downward and to the right, before levelling off and ending just above the x axis where x equals 3.

The figure presents the graph of f in the x y coordinate plane. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a smooth curve. The curve begins above the x axis, where x equals negative 3, and moves gradually downward and to the right until it levels off at a point just above the x axis, where x equals negative 1. It then moves steeply upward and to the right and levels off on the y axis at 1.5. The curve then moves steeply downward and to the right and levels off at a point just above the x axis, where x equals 1. The curve then moves gradually upward and to the right, before levelling off and ending above the x axis where x equals 3.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of f in the x y coordinate plane. The numbers negative 3 through 3, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 2 through 2, in increments of 1, are indicated on the y axis. The graph is a smooth curve. The curve begins just above the x axis, where x equals negative 3, and moves gradually upward and to the right until it levels off at the point with approximate coordinates negative 1 comma 0.5. It then moves steeply downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately negative 0.5, and levels off on the y axis at negative 2. The curve then moves steeply upward and to the right, crosses the x axis at approximately 0.5, and levels off at the point with approximate coordinates 1 comma 0.5. The curve then moves gradually downward and to the right, before levelling off and ending just above the x axis where x equals 3.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
